TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit HttpParseException extends System.Web.HttpException

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when a parse error occurs.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The HttpParseException class is an HTTP-specific exception class that enables ASP.NET to output parser exception information. For more information on throwing and handling exceptions, see [Exceptions](../Topic/Handling%20and%20Throwing%20Exceptions.md).
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the HttpParseException to customize errors generated during page parsing. In this example, a customized <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelect> control is defined. If child elements of the custom control are not of a specified type then an HttpParseException is thrown in the overridden <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelectBuilder.GetChildControlType%2A> method of a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelectBuilder>. To generate a parse exception, change the child element literal `MyCustomOption` to any other string.
[!code-cs[HttpParseException#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.web.httpparseex_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[HttpParseException#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.web.httpparseex_1.aspx)]
[!code-vb[HttpParseException#2](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.web.httpparseex_2.vb)] [!code-cs[HttpParseException#2](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.web.httpparseex_2.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public HttpParseException (string message, Exception innerException, string virtualPath, string sourceCode, int line);

The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If `innerException` is not , the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.
The virtual path for the exception.
The source code being compiled when the exception occurs.
The line number on which the exception occurred.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with specific information about the source code being compiled and the line number on which the exception occurred.
Gets the name of the file being parsed when the error occurs.
Docs.value: The physical path to the source file that is being parsed when the error occurs; otherwise, , if the physical path is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The FileName property returns the physical path to the source file that has the error unless the physical path is `null`, in which case it returns `null`.

Docs.returns: The physical path to the source file that is being parsed when the error occurs; otherwise, , if the physical path is .

MemberSignature.Value: public override void GetObjectData (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void GetObjectData(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the object with information about the exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetObjectData method sets a <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> object with all the exception object data targeted for serialization. During deserialization, the exception is reconstituted from the SerializationInfo transmitted over the stream.
## Examples The following code example shows how to define a derived serializable <xref:System.Exception> class that implements the GetObjectData method, which makes minor changes to two properties, and then calls the base class to perform the serialization. The example forces a divide-by-0 error, and then creates an instance of the derived <xref:System.Exception>. The code serializes the instance to a file, deserializes the file into a new <xref:System.Exception>, which it throws, and then catches and displays the exception's data.
[!code-cs[System.Exception.GetObjectData#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/6cb4e3e6-a72d-483a-994d-_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Exception.GetObjectData#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/6cb4e3e6-a72d-483a-994d-_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Exception.GetObjectData#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/6cb4e3e6-a72d-483a-994d-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the number of the line being parsed when the error occurs.
Docs.value: The number of the line being parsed when the error occurs. This value is 1-based, not 0-based.
Docs.returns: The number of the line being parsed when the error occurs. This value is 1-based, not 0-based.

Docs.summary: Gets the parser errors for the current exception.
Docs.value: A collection of the parser errors for the current exception.
Docs.returns: A collection of the parser errors for the current exception.

Docs.summary: Gets the virtual path to source file that generated the error.
Docs.value: The virtual path to the source file that generated the error.
Docs.returns: The virtual path to the source file that generated the error.
